pr_title: Have Baggage context interaction API mirror Span.

timeline.message: Have Baggage context interaction API mirror Span.

timeline.bodyText: oh, good catch! good thing it's just a name. :)
timeline.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: do we still need the class to be public?
timeline.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: As long as TracingContextUtils, yes, I suggest we keep it public (and TracingContextUtils should probably stay public to be Specification compliant).
replies.author: carlosalberto

replies.bodyText: even if none of the methods are public?
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: It does not need to be public, the specification says that the context interaction functionality can be added in few places, and avoid duplicate. So that needs to not be public.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText:
You guys can do whatever you want 😉  But if I may give my opinion, it looks really weird to be we have TracingContextUtils and no equivalent for BaggageUtils (why didn't we have public methods there, btw?)
Also, the specification says:

they MAY be exposed as static methods on the trace module, as static methods on a class inside the trace module (it MAY be named TracingContextUtilities), or on the Tracer class.

Sure, it only mentions the trace portion, but I would have hoped it would be similar for Baggage ;)
replies.author: carlosalberto

timeline.bodyText: Do we need this? People can compare with empty or can check for size of entries.
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: May be in a separate PR.
replies.author: bogdandrutu
